intro: Phyllanthus dorotheae, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and smooth, fleshy leaves. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Phyllanthus dorotheae is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
